The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Vast Corridor (1641)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

Inside the Archway
  There is no visible light source in the cavern.  Even light brought in
anticipation of the darkness seems to wither and fail in the curse of this
place.  With every step, the walls seem to shrink in, making the air thick
and musty.  The sounds here echo all around with no definite source.  
 
            Sounds echo in your ears.....

                        Sounds echo in your imagination.....
 
The ground begins to descend to deeper unseeable depths.

A Well Worn Path
  The stones have run out and the well-packed dirt serves as a solid path
through the middle of the market.  Sounds of children are definitely coming
from the south now, and a strange mixture of smells is coming from the
north.  Crowds of people push and shove their way to the produce stands,
anxious to get the best available, and at the best price.

Walkway Through the Market
  The hard packed dirt appears to be a bit more trampled here.  The dirt is
torn up towards the north and small footprints can be seen darting around
the south exit.  Street hawkers, gossiping shoppers and the shrieks of
children at play mix together in a cacophony of chaotic sounds.  The market
spreads in every direction.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Invis) (Red Aura) (White Aura) A Djinn in white pantaloons stands here, looking around.
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) A young magician seems to be hiding from someone.
(Golden Aura) A guard roams through the bazaar, looking for anyone out of line.
(Red Aura) B'Enrai is here, offering a selection of narcotics to his needy clientele.
B'Enrai says, "Come here. Yes, I mean you."
B'Enrai says, "Take a look, have a sniff. You won't find better stuff
 anywhere else."
B'Enrai grins evilly at you.  Hmmm.  Better keep your distance.
B'Enrai exclaims, "Don't walk away without trying some!"

-vconfig-  seperate multiple commands with | instead of ;

  -  [port]    Recall portal to use                     cast 'word of recall'
  -  [wield]   Wielded weapon to use                    'holy might'
  -  [dual]    Dual wielded weapon to use               'holy might'
  -  [held]    Held item to return after using portals  deadline
  -  [spellup] Spellup to use                           napalm;spellup
  -  [hpot]    Health potion to use                     breakfast
  -  [mpot]    Mana potion to use                       moonlight
  -  [vpot]    Moves potion to use                      refreshing
  -  [pbag]    Potions bag                              backpack
  -  [bag]     General bag                              backpack
  -  [attack1] Primary attack                           ca flaming
  -  [attack2] Secondary attack                         ca vamp
  -  [debuff1] First debuff                             ca poison
  -  [debuff2] Second debuff                            ca wither
  -  [cplvl]   Level to CP level until                  150
  -  [cpexp]   CP Level noexp toggle amount             700
  -  [group]   Group Frame Format until                 1
  -  [tdiff]   Time Difference from Mud Time            7
  -  [speak]   Speak audio alerts                       false

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

e
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

1913/1913 HP  2322/2322 MP  1675/1676 mv  547tnl  
Lv 86  G 889936 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

w
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1913/1913 HP  2322/2322 MP  1673/1676 mv  547tnl  
Lv 86  G 889936 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Floating Temple
  This is the Floating Temple of Jupiter, the god of sky and thunder. A 
transparent tarp hangs above you, shading you from the sun. The tarp leaves 
the sky visible as a tribute to Jupiter. Several statues stand silently 
against the wall, judging you. The wall is decorated with a story of Jupiter.

dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.

being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger

Before a Small Castle
  As the path ends you stand before a small stone castle.  Looking up, you
see one single tower spiraling into the sky.  The gate to the castle is
closed and nobody stands guard.  The castle looks as though it has been kept
up well though.  Its walls are perfectly intact, and the grass around it has
recently been trimmed.  Yet, the castle looks absolutely deserted.

The Gallery of Champions
  You stand in a huge art gallery.  Many paintings of men and women in
armor line the walls.  You guess that these are portraits of previous
tournament winners.  Examining the paintings, you see that whoever made them
has exceptional artistic skill.  Perhaps you can tell the artist that you
are a knight also and commission yourself a painting?

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1913/1913 HP  2272/2322 MP  1676/1676 mv  547tnl  
Lv 86  G 899028 | Falling Down the Stairs (E)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Iron Door
  You stand outside a large iron door. A small corridor leads off to the south.
The walls of the corridor are rough hewn stone, and are covered with moss and
slime. Water drips down from the ceiling, and pools of stagnant water sit in 
depressions in the floor. A large iron peg is embedded in the east wall.

help wraith form
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Wraith Form'.
Help Category : Enhancement.
Related Helps : Wolf Spirits, Sanctuary, Biofeedback.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-29 18:43:13.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'wraith form'
Spell Number: 180

Through the use of this spell the caster can assume the abilities of one
of the undead. This spell is most useful when preparing for a major battle.
A caster who is both wise and intelligent has a chance of improving his
stats with the casting of this spell.

Spell available only to the Primary Class Mages.

Primary stat: Intelligence, Wisdom.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

>>    *[NOEXP]* Guard Room
  This large room is used by Guards who make sure that no unauthorized people 
are wandering around the Fortress. The room is sparsely furnished, containing
only a large stone table, and a few chairs. The floor is dirty, and littered 
with bones and food scraps. Much of the walls are covered with scrawled words
written in the ugly Yurgach script. You should be glad you can't read them!

>>    *[NOEXP]* Guard Room
  This large room is used by Guards who make sure that no unauthorized people 
are wandering around the Fortress. The room is sparsely furnished, containing
only a large stone table, and a few chairs. The floor is dirty, and littered 
with bones and food scraps. Much of the walls are covered with scrawled words
written in the ugly Yurgach script. You should be glad you can't read them!

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east down ]

Lexicon moves into the shadows.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
(Player) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1671)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

help pass
Help 'pass' was not found - possible alternatives are:
Pass door           : Enables the caster to pass through some closed doors.  
Pass without trace  : Enables the user to walk around while hidden.          
Password            : Used to change your password.                          

[*Daily Blessing*] 1913/1913 HP  2322/2322 MP  1647/1676 mv  783tnl  
Lv 86  G 899592 | Hidden gully (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
help pass door
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Pass door' passdoor.
Help Category : Enhancement.
Related Helps : Ectoplasmic Form, Lock, Pick, Open.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-29 09:55:16.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'pass door'
Spell Number: 64

This spell moves your body out of phase, making you translucent and able
to move through closed doors. However, be aware that some doors have
powerful magical wards upon them that will block a pass door attempt.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : None.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Disciples Auditorium (G)
  Heavy Corinthian columns support the auditorium building. The quiet 
atmosphere provides a relaxed feeling of peace and learning. There are 
rows of benches inside, which look very well used. The lectures and 
interviews that take place here must be drawing quite a crowd. 
The SIGN on the western wall directs your attention, where a polite
Disciple of Hassan approaches slowly and welcomes you inside.

[ Exits: east (south) up ]
     (Magic) A cuddly cow moos softly.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) An enormous beanbag fills the room.
Sashan is here teaching to a class of novices.
Fourak, Sashan's cousin is here, tending to those in need.
Omra, Sashan's other cousin is here, handing out quests.

Thalos Road
  Much to the chagrin of the Old Thalos holy clergy, the New Thalos
merchants have spilled out of the city-proper and have begun to pop up tents
on either side of the main road.  The merchants peddle such a wide array of
both common and exotic items, it would be easy to lose oneself amidst the
splendor of the multitude of offerings.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1659)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Disciples Auditorium (G)
  Heavy Corinthian columns support the auditorium building. The quiet 
atmosphere provides a relaxed feeling of peace and learning. There are 
rows of benches inside, which look very well used. The lectures and 
interviews that take place here must be drawing quite a crowd. 
The SIGN on the western wall directs your attention, where a polite
Disciple of Hassan approaches slowly and welcomes you inside.

[ Exits: east (south) up ]
     (Magic) A cuddly cow moos softly.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) An enormous beanbag fills the room.
Sashan is here teaching to a class of novices.
Fourak, Sashan's cousin is here, tending to those in need.
Omra, Sashan's other cousin is here, handing out quests.
A (-Dohbie-) Distillery

help pass doo

Help 'pass doo' was not found - displaying help 'Pass door':
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Pass door' passdoor.
Help Category : Enhancement.
Related Helps : Ectoplasmic Form, Lock, Pick, Open.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-29 09:55:16.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'pass door'
Spell Number: 64

This spell moves your body out of phase, making you translucent and able
to move through closed doors. However, be aware that some doors have
powerful magical wards upon them that will block a pass door attempt.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : None.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1913/1913 HP  2322/2322 MP  1676/1676 mv  783tnl  
Lv 86  G 895192 | Disciples Auditorium (E[S]U)

(Friend): Gorsk is agreeing with that LiamSmythe person again...

help mist form
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'MIST FORM'.
Help Category : Transport.
Last Updated  : 2017-09-01 09:01:58.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:  mist <direction1> (<direction2>)

This ethereal ability allows its target to move through a single room
completely undetected. While in mist form, the target cannot be detected or
attacked by normal means, allowing the user to pass through potentially
dangerous rooms without harm.

If you only enter one direction, you will attempt to move that direction
twice.  If you move in an invalid direction, you will stop where you are.
You cannot use mist form in clan rooms or out of a prison-flagged room.
Some monsters have abilities (such as those that happen upon entering or
leaving a room) that may still fire and interrupt the ability.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1913/1913 HP  2322/2322 MP  1676/1676 mv  783tnl  
Lv 86  G 895192 | Disciples Auditorium (E[S]U)
>>    *[NOEXP]*

Edge of the forest (1619)

Path before the Gate
  You stand on a wide, well-worn path that leads away to the west and
toward a distant forest of tall blackpines.  All around you is silence.  No
birds sing, no insects chirp; even the wind is still.  Perhaps it is the
presence of the Black Tower that stands before you to the south.  A large
black gate blocks the path directly to the south, and unless you carry the
key, you can go no further in this direction.  Perhaps it is just as well;
this place looks nasty!  

[ Exits: (south) west ]
     A black iron key lies here.
(Red Aura) An ugly looking Yurgach stands on guard before the gate.
(Red Aura) An ugly looking Yurgach stands on guard before the gate.

On the Stairway (1602)

Falling Down the Stairs
  Whoops! Your armor overbalances you and you slip on some slime, suddenly you 
find yourself falling down the steep stone stairway into the darkness below.
Looking around you realise that you have fallen into a deep pit. A sturdy 
iron door is set into the east wall, you hope it's not locked, as there seems
to be no other way out, the ceiling has closed up, and you assume that it 
must be some kind of a trap-door, and you fell right into the trap!

[ Exits: (east) ]

Top of the Stairway
  You stand at the top of a narrow stair leading down to the lower levels of 
the Yurgach Fortress. To the north you see a large stone doorway. The area is
lit by the light of flickering torches placed in wall sconces at intervals 
along the corridor and stairway. The air is damp, smokey, and generally 
unpleasant.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Torture Chamber (G)
  You enter a dark room, lit only by a small brazier containing burning coals 
sitting in one corner. On the far side of the room you see a collection of 
horrific and sadistic looking implements of torture. Iron maidens and racks 
are in lined up along one wall, and a table covered with thumb-screws, 
needles, pincers, tongs, branding-irons and other items, sits in the middle 
of the room. This room is obviously where the Yurgach torture their 
prisoners, or just come to have some fun, after a hard day beating the slaves
and killing people.  After a closer inspection, it appears you might be able
to squeeze inside the brazier, if you're willing to risk getting stuck.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1672)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Aardington Estate
  You stand before a large wrought iron gate which is tipped with iron 
arrowheads and decorated with an iron worked coat of arms. To either side of 
the gate is a long iron fence disguised by dark green leafy shrubs, giving it
the natural appearance of a simple hedge at first glance. On the other side 
of the gate is a path of small white stones, which leads directly to an 
enormous bluestone manor situated in the middle of a vast, sprawling estate.

[ Exits: (north) south ]

A path through the estate [**> PK <**] (1659)

Before a temple
  The temple is made from the same stones that make up the manor itself. The 
temple is dedicated to Ayla, though it is open to all who seek peace and 
solitude. There are three low, flat bluestone steps leading up to the temple 
doors, which are made from a heavy wood and have large iron rings to open 
them outwards. On the walls either side of the door, ivy grows quite 
prolifically, the vines clinging to the stony surface.

[ Exits: north (east) south west ]
     (Magic) Ivy clings to the stony surface of the temple.
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
(Golden Aura) A lost hedgehog wanders through the garden beds, making quite the mess.
(Red Aura) A busy little bee buzzes from flower to flower, collecting pollen.
(Red Aura) A bee busily buzzes from flower to flower collecting pollen.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1751/1913 HP  1575/2322 MP  1676/1676 mv  673tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 86  G 997570 | Before a temple (NESW)
>>    Temple foyer
  The foyer of the temple is cool and dim, allowing you to reflect on your time
here, whether coming or going. There are some ancient scrolls, situated 
behind glass, on pedestals to the left and right of the main doors. A white 
pillar candle, large enough to need three wicks, sits in each of the two 
arched niches, to the left and right of the inner temple door. Below each 
candle is a bronze plate, with offerings of gold and flowers, for the 
resident goddess, Ayla.

[ Exits: (east) west ]
     (Magic) A white pillar candle flickers brightly.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) Wearing slightly muddy robes, this sister is carrying a bunch of freshly
picked flowers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1751/1913 HP  1575/2322 MP  1676/1676 mv  673tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 86  G 997570 | Temple foyer (EW)
>>    Wooden pews
  There are many wooden pews in the temple to choose from for quiet prayer and 
reflection. Some of these pews have occupants, who have come for their own 
varied reasons, to pray to Ayla for comfort and peace. There is an old couple
sitting in the back row, their hands clasped tightly in each other's as they 
seek comfort in their time of prayer. There is a young lady, with a bunch of 
yellow daisies in her hand, weeping quietly towards the middle of the temple.
At the far end is a raised dais, upon which a large book sits on a simple 
wooden pedestal.

[ Exits: east west ]
     (Magic) Bloodshot eyes are brimming with tears.
     (Magic) Wooden pews line the main temple in neat rows.

>>    Wooden pews (1674)

A memorial alcove
  This alcove is dedicated to the memory of those who have passed from the 
living realms. Many small candles have been placed on long shelves along one 
of the walls. The wax from these candles has pooled and dried on the shelves,
creating a stable environment for the multitude of candles that have been 
placed here. A large box with a small slit at the top stands against the 
southern wall. Inside this box are letters to the goddess Ayla asking for 
help, blessings and offering of prayers.

[ Exits: north (down) ]
     (Magic) Many small candles burn for the dead.
You have 6 tells waiting. Type 'replay' to see them.

Catacombs [**> PK <**] (1671)

Catacombs
  A long, low moan drifts to you through the dark tunnels to the south. The 
sound of splintering wood snaps in the background and something heavy falls 
to the tiled floor. A cold breath of stale air brushes past you, enticing 
goose bumps to form. The sandstone walls are cold to the touch and crumble 
slightly under pressure, the grit falling to the floor in small showers. The 
passageway to the south is dark, while to the east you can see the light from
the entrance to the catacombs.

[ Exits: east south ]

Catacombs [**> PK <**]
  The walls of the catacombs are made of a soft sandstone, which crumbles 
slightly under your touch. The tiled floor has weathered the passage of time 
quite well, though one of them looks to have cracked. The air is dry and 
dusty, having been sealed up from the outside world for some time. A low moan
drifts to you from deeper into the tunnels that branch off to the east and 
west. To the north is the way out and back up to the temple.

[ Exits: north east west ]
(Red Aura) All bones and sinew, this undead grotesque turns its dead eyes in your direction.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1157/1913 HP  1067/2322 MP  1675/1676 mv  341tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 86  G 1004184 | Catacombs (NEW)
[**> PK <**] >>    Catacombs
  A large, empty cobweb hangs limply from the corner, moving only under the 
gentle coaxing from the draft of air which preceded you into these tunnels.
The scraping of bone on stone sounds from within the dark, grating on your 
senses, alerting you to the presence of something nearby. An evil presence 
sends a paralysing chill through you, coaxing goose bumps to arise over your 
entire body. You still have time to leave these confining catacombs, the way 
out is to the west.

[ Exits: south west ]
     (Magic) A large empty cobweb hangs limply in the corner.
(Red Aura) A twisted corpse staggers along, bumping carelessly into obstacles in its circular path.

Catacombs [**> PK <**] (1675)

Entrance to the catacombs (1674)

A memorial alcove (1673)

Wooden pews
  At the front section of the pews you can see more of the temple. To the north
is a secluded alcove, with a wooden screen, which has been folded back 
against the wall, revealing two comfortable chairs. To the south is an alcove
with many candles burning in niches in the walls. To the north you can see 
the altar behind the pedestal, which is covered with fruit, flowers and 
plates of jewellery and gold. In the front pew is an old man, white beard 
flowing down his chest. He does not notice your presence, his eyes staring up
at the large tapestry of Ayla, hanging on the back wall, his lips moving 
ceaselessly in a never ending prayer to the goddess.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) Wooden pews line the main temple in neat rows.
(Golden Aura) Studiously polishing the wooden surfaces in the temple, this sister ignores your
presence.
(Golden Aura) An old man with a flowing white beard is praying to Ayla.
You have 6 tells waiting. Type 'replay' to see them.

Lv 86  G 1006802 | Wooden pews (NESW)
>>    Wooden pews
  There are many wooden pews in the temple to choose from for quiet prayer and 
reflection. Some of these pews have occupants, who have come for their own 
varied reasons, to pray to Ayla for comfort and peace. There is an old couple
sitting in the back row, their hands clasped tightly in each other's as they 
seek comfort in their time of prayer. There is a young lady, with a bunch of 
yellow daisies in her hand, weeping quietly towards the middle of the temple.
At the far end is a raised dais, upon which a large book sits on a simple 
wooden pedestal.

[ Exits: east west ]

>>    Temple foyer
  The foyer of the temple is cool and dim, allowing you to reflect on your time
here, whether coming or going. There are some ancient scrolls, situated 
behind glass, on pedestals to the left and right of the main doors. A white 
pillar candle, large enough to need three wicks, sits in each of the two 
arched niches, to the left and right of the inner temple door. Below each 
candle is a bronze plate, with offerings of gold and flowers, for the 
resident goddess, Ayla.

Approaching a dark wood (1669)

A dark wood (1668)

A dark wood
  Deep in the dark wood you stumble upon a secluded cabin that looks a little 
worse for wear. The trees have grown right up against the walls and there are
some seedlings on the rotting wooden roof. A once tidy rose garden has now 
grown wild and they have spread all over the immediate area, climbing up the 
walls of the cabin. They have created a thicket of thorns that it would be 
wise to stay away from. A large dragonfly, with long gossamer wings, buzzes 
right past you.

[ Exits: north (east) south west ]
     (Magic) A rough, winding trail leads through the trees.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Mons Brevia (1654)

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"
Beatrice says, "You can say 'Cathedral', 'Castle', or 'Mine' to be sent to
 those parts of DSR."

run s;o s;run 3sd2wd2e;o e;e;o s;run 2sd
Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north (south) ]
(Red Aura) A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
(Red Aura) A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
(Golden Aura) A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
(Golden Aura) A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

Inside a strange city (1680)

Approaching Diamond Castle (1679)

In front of Diamond Castle
  Doric columns of pure diamond support this magnificent castle.  Beams of
light encircle the dwelling, illuminating the crystal with an holy
brilliance and a divine majesty.  You slowly raise your hand up to feel the
outer wall, and despite having been exposed to the elements, it is as soft
and tender as a baby's skin, while still having an untold of inner
resilience.  You bow your head in respect for the castle, and notice a
welcome mat on the ground.  The mat is completely lavish as well, having
been woven with intertwined strands of gold and silver.  If the exterior is
any indication, the beauty and grace to be found within will surpass any
you have seen.  

[ Exits: (east) west ]
(Golden Aura) A citizen of this strange city is here smiling at you.
(Golden Aura) A caspian guard is here keeping peace in the city.
(Red Aura) A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1245/1939 HP  876/2355 MP  1678/1694 mv  635tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1024960 | In front of Diamond Castle (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  After opening the diamond gate and entering the castle, your senses are
overcome with amazement and wonder.  Even the inner walls of this
magnificent castle are made of diamond.  As you step across the floor, the
shock of your feet smacking the ground is absorbed, and instead of making a
cacophonous sound, you hear a soft bell chiming in the distance.  It seems
as if the destructive sound energy is converted into a harmonious melody. 
You sigh in utter bliss as you realize that nothing will hurt you here ... 
provided you treat it well.  To your north is a diamond fence which
separates the rest of the castle from the arborium, and to the south is the
castle dining room.  The castle hallway continues east.  

[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1245/1939 HP  876/2355 MP  1677/1694 mv  635tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1024960 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N][E]SW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside the dining room (1677)

Inside the dining room (1677)

Inside the kitchen
  The various cooks and maids gather together here, as it is their "home
base," so to speak.  You smell so much stuff at once that your nose cannot
register it all: beef stew, delectible fried shrimp, golden brown chicken
...  There is just so much to cook that the chefs have problems keeping up
with it all.  The serving maids are running back and forth so much that
there is a huge rut in the floor where their feet tread so hastily.  A huge
cauldron hordes the space in the kitchen's center, and it is there where the
cooks magically bake, fry, and marinate everything.  How they do it, you
don't know.  The dining room is above you and a tiny door to the west
functions as a service entrance to the kitchen.  

[ Exits: (west) up ]

(Red Aura) A maid is here trying to annoy the cooks.
(Golden Aura) A cook is here running frantically back and forth.
(Red Aura) A maid is here trying to annoy the cooks.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.

(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

e
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1939/1939 HP  2355/2355 MP  1651/1694 mv  635tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1014794 | Into the dark (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Walk of the Stars - Luna
  A cold stream of moonlight makes a curious circuit through these stars,
shining like a polished pearl.  Flowing out of the moongate, it goes past
Canopus, down and around Rigel, then west to Zaurac.  From there, it then
heads north past Absolvo Te, north to Kitalpha, and around to the east until
it has come full circle.  Kitalpha is just northwest of here, the moongate
being far to the northeast and Absolvo Te being off to the southwest.

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

[ Exits: (up) ]
     (Glow) (Hum) (Cursed) Davem's keyring

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.

(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1939/1939 HP  2355/2355 MP  1651/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1020701 | Into the dark (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Walk of the Stars - Requiem
  This path through the stars seems to have been formed by magic from the
music of an imperial dirge.  The terrifying power of this song, played
whenever those who control the metallic moon go into battle, resonates not
with sadness for those lost, but with the reminder of the doom which awaits
any who oppose them.  This terrifying path winds a circle past Bunda, down
to Deneb and Gianfar, west between Chort and Spica, turning north near
Corona Aerianni, then east, meandering between Nasil and Zacuto to complete
its circuit.  Chort is just south of here and Spica is just northwest.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

A dark forest

also unnaturally dark. Regardless of the time of day, the forest stays the 
same brightness. Even the sounds of the forest have been muffled by some

The battle path around the castle
  The southern path around the castle is filled with carnage and mayhem.
Scavengers fight and peck the fallen kobolds which have been pushed off of 
the path. The siege has been the hardest for the kobolds around this path, 
without much damage to the castle. Without warning, the ground shakes with a 
muffled thud, followed by mad cackling. Perhaps that sound could be 
investigated further to discover the source.

The battle path around the castle
  The innumerable footprints of kobolds and Eldar have created a hard path of 
dirt and blood. The path juts around the castle, extending from the footings 
of the castle out to the barricades of the camp. The castle rises up to the

indicative of a siege.

The battle path around the castle
  The innumerable footprints of kobolds and Eldar have created a hard path of 
dirt and blood. The path juts around the castle, extending from the footings 
of the castle out to the barricades of the camp. The castle rises up to the 
east, with enormous towers on the south and north corners of the castle.
Corpses are strewn about the path, creating a sight and stench that is
indicative of a siege.

At the corner of the castle (1694)

At the corner of the castle
  At the southwest corner of the castle, the path splits between the north and 
east paths around the castle. The fields to the west, which serve as both a 
preparation area and a killing field, show the kobolds' camp in the distance.
The sounds of battle on the path drown out the sounds of the forest to the 
south and the camp to the far west. Looking straight up, there is a massive 
tower extending from the corner of the castle.

At the corner of the castle (1694)

At the corner of the castle
  The south side of the castle seems to have taken the brunt of the damage from
the kobolds. Huge chunks of stone have been knocked free from the walls, 
revealing a slightly lighter color of stone beneath. Although there is no 
telling how thick the walls are, the massive pocks in the wall must be 
weakening the structural integrity of the wall. Along with the massive damage
comes massive casualties. Kobold and Eldar bodies are strewn about in various
stages of decay. The road is littered with bones of all shapes and sizes, all
of which are weathered and cracked.

The battle path around the castle (1694)

At the corner of the castle
  The path around the southern part of the castle has been cut directly out of 
the forest. The forest continues to the south, dense and moist, dangerous and
unforgiving. The corpses of kobolds litter the path, fresh ones piling on top
of the bones of their brothers in arms. Small pocks in the castle walls prove
the kobolds have been successful, though the level of success is debatable.
The path continues to the east, with the forest's daunting blackness to the 
south.

Lv 87  G 1033674 | The battle path around the castle (NSW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1690)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Approaching the Nenukon (1657)

Edge of the Nenukon (G)
  You stand at the edge of the Nenukon. A dark and twisted region of the world.
Deep within lies what is said to be the ultimate evil, and also the resting 
place of the only thing that can stop it. Beyond the Nenukon is said to be 
the Empire of The Far Country, a land of warriors, where the governing tribes
themselves are in a constant state of war.

[ Exits: south west ]

s
Demon's Halo Mountains
  These mountains appear to jut up from the ground here from nowhere, as
the surrounding area appears to be flat plains.  The unusual composition of
the rocks here also appear to be completely different from the rest of the
continent, adding to the mystery of the range.  A desert seems to occupy the
area inside this ring of mountains as well, another mystery of this
otherwise temperate land.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

  The land becomes harder to trek through at this point.  The sandstone
seems to lurch out of the ground at awkward angles, in higher and higher
degrees as the plains of Alagh make way for the giant mountain range which
encircles the inner portion of the continent here, known to all as the
Demon's Halo.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Alagh, the Blood Lands
  The crimson dust of this plain swirls in small eddies around your feet as
you trek onward.  A sharp metallic taste tinges the air as the flat plain
extends onward to the east and south.  Northward the sandstone formations
start to give way for even larger rock formation, leading up into a large
mountain ring that seems to encircle the inner portion of the land.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Tiger Rock
  An outcropping of rock juts up from the blood red plain here.  Large
streaks of metallic red run all along the rock, giving it a striped look. 
The yellow hue of the rock contrasts sharply with the rest of the region,
giving the rock an almost tiger-like appearance.  The crimson plains extend
in all directions from here, although small blots of green can vaguely been
seen to the southwest of here.

Rainforest Outskirts
  The soft green glow of the forest blends with the red skies of the blood
plains as you enter the fringes of the rainforest.  The ground underfoot is
a mix of damp earth and red dust from which sprout tufts of green grass and
thin plants.  The trees cling to the rocky terraces and are oddly misshapen.
A dry wind picks up the dust from the ground and blows it deeper into the
rainforest.  A colony of ants swarms a large red ant mound at your feet.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1499)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

Sentry Post
  The sentry post is a slightly elevated tower that stands over the moat.
Here, a few men of the king will gather and if not on duty, sometimes will 
play at cards or dice to while away the time. During peaceful times, it is 
not uncommon to have quite a big tournament, where the losers are thrown into
the moat with much laughter among the men.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1690)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1540/1939 HP  907/2355 MP  1694/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1054836 | Guest Room of the Wave Runner ([N])
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

------------------------------------------------------------
You step inside the fog and find yourself elsewhere.

Beachside landing
  Waves gently lap at the glimmering sands here, creating a calming rhythmic 
hum in your ears. Just off the shallow waters you see a group of ships, 
seamen tirelessly unloading supplies. Inland a short distance, you spot a 
makeshift camp positioned just before a towering forest. A dim rainbow arcs 
up in front of the camp like an entryway.

Into the forest (1686)

Wandering through the ironwoods (1684)

Wandering through the ironwoods (1683)

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north east ]
     (Magic) A sturdy slab of iron from the ironwood trees looks impervious to damage.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood psithurist plays a faint but dulcet tune on its leaves.
(Golden Aura) The branches of this Ironwood snap shut violently as you get near.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood psithurist plays a faint but dulcet tune on its leaves.

The Desolate Pridelands (1629)

The Desolate Pridelands (G) (1628)

The Desolate Pridelands
  You discover a large unused mine shaft in the middle of the mountains. 
Noises can be heard coming from the bottom but there appears to be no way to
climb down.  You could probably survive a fall down there though.  

[ Exits: north east south west other ]
A drascone wisps in the air.
(Golden Aura) A jahirak looks about.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1614/1939 HP  778/2355 MP  1627/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1058358 | The Desolate Pridelands (NESW*)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
------------------------------------------------------------
You fall into the mine shaft and land with a thud, otherwise unharmed.
------------------------------------------------------------
Standing before the tombs
  The fall from the shaft didn't seem so bad from above, but the landing didn't
feel great. As the dust settles from your landing, you get your first look 
around the area. There is a brick wall to the west, north and east. A ladder 
stands against the wall to the north, leading back to the continent. To the 
south lies an open doorway from which few noises can be heard and very little
light can be seen. Oddly enough, there's a peaceful feeling to this room, but
something tells you that won't be the case for long.

[ Exits: south up ]
     An old ladder stands here.  There's something hanging from one of the steps.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Rilnyi, the watcher of the crypts, stands here wondering
why you have come.
Rilnyi says, "Hello, friend. We could use a little help down here."
Rilnyi says, "It's been so long since a mortal has come here."

[*Daily Blessing*] 1614/1939 HP  778/2355 MP  1626/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1058358 | Standing before the tombs (SU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* You seem unable to hunt that target for some reason.

Lv 87  G 1058358 | Standing before the tombs (SU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
rfa small cell

 You have no recollection of any room with that name.
s
Entering the tombs
  As you step into the building, you notice dust once again fills the air. The 
brick walls are covered in cobwebs and unlit torches. There's an iron doorway
to the west, and a large keyhole is visible above the knob. A small draft of 
warm air can be felt coming from beneath the door. There is a bend in the 
hallway to east, which seems to be even darker than it is here.

[ Exits: north east (west) ]
A bat flies suddenly overhead, nearly hitting you dead in the face.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1614/1939 HP  778/2355 MP  1625/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1058358 | Entering the tombs (NE[W])
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
A turn in the hallway
  Venturing further into the crypts, it appears to get darker. More noises can 
also be heard, but the source cannot yet be determined. There's a solid 
wooden door to the east that is lacking a keyhole. There are no signs above 
the door to indicate what the room may be used for. To the south, the dark 
hallway continues and to the west you can see very little sunlight entering 
the hallway.

[ Exits: (east) south west ]
     A large pile of dust has gathered on the floor here.

Deeper in the tombs
  It is very dark inside this dungeon. Perhaps lighting one of the torches on 
the wall would help brighten the place a bit? There's a strange wooden door 
to the east. Above the door, a skull hangs from the ceiling. This must be the
entrance to the tombs area of the dungeons. This hallways also continues 
south, and a stairway can be seen to the west.

An abrupt end
  The dungeon corridor ends here. You nearly smack your face into the western 
wall, not knowing the hallway was about to end so suddenly. A doorway can 
barely be visible to the south, but nothing else can be seen about it. No 
signs, warnings, nothing. The feelings of curiosity are almost more than one 
can handle.

used for. The exit from this tomb lies to the south.

e
Intersection in the hall of the damned
  These hallways are very reminiscent of the hallways from the tombs, except 
there is much more movement and sound here. There are lit torches hanging 
from the ceiling, and there is moisture in the air. There are obviously 
beings assigned to keep these hallways clean and bright. There are exits 
north, east, and west. The exit from these halls lies to the south.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1451/1939 HP  287/2355 MP  1691/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald)

s
Before the Hall of the Damned (G)
  The building before you appears to be a structure for keeping the souls that 
have left the bodies of the tombs at bay. There is no door on the building, 
but there appears to be no visible exit from this area. Perhaps this is what 
was floating in the strange orange aura floating above the tombs? The only 
exit is to the north, which ventures into the halls of the damned.

n
Hallway of the damned
  As this hallway continues, the noises seems to become softer and the lighting
a bit dim. To the north, an intersection of two hallways can be seen. A small
pool of water has accumulated on the floor here. A small opening in the 
ceiling reveals the source of the water. To the south, activity can be seen 
as the hallway continues.

[ Exits: north south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1483/1939 HP  278/2355 MP  1686/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1063025 | Hallway of the damned (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
An intersection of hallways
  Two hallways within the halls of the damned come to a meeting here. The 
hallway extending east appears to be a bit darker, with less activity, while 
the hallway to the south is well lit and has a good amount of more activity.
There are markings on the walls here, but they are not of any meaning to 
mortals.

[ Exits: east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1483/1939 HP  278/2355 MP  1683/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1063025 | An intersection of hallways (ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
A small cell
  You have stumbled upon a cell of sorts within these halls. There are no 
shackles, chains or bars here, since the inhabitants of these halls would be 
able to easily escape them. There are three lit torches on each wall, proving
more than enough light to see everything within the cell.

[ Exits: east ]

  You are deep inside the halls of the damned. Although there is no apparent 
light source in this hallway, the light extending from the surrounding halls

a bit dim. To the north, an intersection of two hallways can be seen. A small
pool of water has accumulated on the floor here. A small opening in the 
ceiling reveals the source of the water. To the south, activity can be seen 
as the hallway continues.

[ Exits: north south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1517/1939 HP  324/2355 MP  1684/1694 mv  817tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 87  G 1063025 | Hallway of the damned (NS)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Intersection in the hall of the damned
  These hallways are very reminiscent of the hallways from the tombs, except 
there is much more movement and sound here. There are lit torches hanging 
from the ceiling, and there is moisture in the air. There are obviously 
beings assigned to keep these hallways clean and bright. There are exits 
north, east, and west. The exit from these halls lies to the south.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green

  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

game.)

adventurers.

Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

to be the Great Tournament of Illoria.  Nearby, you hear melodic tunes
playing, and the mixed aromas of cooked meat and fresh pies fill the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]
A man is travelling through the land of the Tzars.
