Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Before a temple (1677)

A beautiful garden
  There is a small, bubbling spring, amongst the many flowering plants, that 
tinkles quietly. River stones have been brought in to make the spring more of
a feature in the garden, as well as giving water to the plants. The stones 
have also formed a shallow bowl, which the birds like to ruffle their 
feathers in. Some insects have taken advantage of the water, laying their 
eggs in the calmer areas. Flowering shrubs offer food and shelter to the 
local wildlife as well as decorating the garden with their unique flowers.

[ Exits: north east ]
     (Magic) A small bubbling spring tinkles quietly.
     (Magic) River stones form a shallow bowl for the birds to play in.
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
(Golden Aura) A bright red bird ruffles its feathers in the cool water.
(Red Aura) A little bee busily buzzes from flower to flower, collecting pollen.
(Red Aura) A busy little bee buzzes from flower to flower, collecting pollen.

Before a temple (1693)

A beautiful garden (1693)

A beautiful garden
  This beautiful garden is very well tended by loving hands. Wild daffodils 
grow along the rocky garden edge, their bright yellow petals, with the 
trumpet-like centre piece, a delight to the local bees and butterflies. A 
bush, with long stems covered in hundreds of tiny purple flowers, sits to the
rear of the garden. The variety of plants and the colours of the flowers are 
quite wondrous. There are some wooden benches placed at intervals on the 
green grass and against the wall of the temple, giving you an opportunity to 
sit in the sun and enjoy the sensory delights of the garden.

[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) Wooden benches sit against the temple wall.
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
(Golden Aura) Lendan distractedly smells the rose he picked from the garden.
(Golden Aura) A little blue wren hops along the path, before taking flight.
(Red Aura) A little bee busily buzzes from flower to flower, collecting pollen.
A rock sits next to a tall daffodil at the edge of the garden.
Wild daffodils grow along the rocky edge of the garden.
(Red Aura) A bee busily buzzes from flower to flower collecting pollen.

Path around the manor (1692)

Before the manor
  Hideous gargoyles, screaming in eternal silence, are guarding the entrance to
the manor from a high perch above, and to either side of, the iron lined, 
wooden double doors. Five wide bluestone steps lead up to a tiled landing 
before the door, which is sheltered by an overhanging eave. On either side of
the door is a potted lemon tree, well pruned and cared for. To the east and 
west a path made from small white stones seems to lead around the manor.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
     (Magic) A white stone path is bordered by leafy green hedges.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.
(Golden Aura) Alert to her surroundings, this guard walks with measured steps.
A pure white butterfly flutters around its mate as they fly through the air.
A potted lemon tree sits beside the door to the manor.
(Golden Aura) A gargoyle sits as still as stone, guarding the manor and those within.
A potted lemon tree sits beside the door to the manor.

>>    Aardington manor (1692)

Grand staircase (1692)

Grand staircase
  A solid marble stair framed by a polished wooden balustrade opens up to the 
top floor of the manor. Opposite the top of the staircase is an antique 
wooden table with a vase of the biggest and brightest red and yellow tulips 
in the lands. There are two hallways that make up the east and west wings of 
the manor and many doors open up off them. Hanging above the centre of the 
staircase is a chandelier that is made up of five layers of rings containing 
magic crystals that twinkle gently with a pale blue light.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west down ]
     (Magic) Hanging above the staircase is a magical chandelier.
     (Magic) A vase of tulips sits on an antique wooden table.
A large oil painting of the manor hangs opposite the stairs.

>>    Bathroom
  A large marble bathtub is the dominant feature in this room. It is big enough
to easily accommodate the mightiest of men with room to spare. The floor is 
made of marble as are the washbasins near the windows, which have a wonderful
view over the kitchen gardens to the north. Brass towel racks hold thick, 
fluffy white towels which are cleaned every day. A large hamper sits beside 
the towel racks for all the used towels. A cupboard houses a pump which is 
used to both fill and empty the water from the tub and basins.

ca flaming 'alert guard'
Aardington manor
  The foyer of the large bluestone manor is quite imposing. Everything in the 
manor speaks of wealth; old and timeless wealth. The floor is made from a 
white and black marble, inlaid with gold veins and specks. A deep, rich red 
carpet runner extends down the length of the main hall from the other side of
the foyer. Solid, polished wooden pedestals stand on either side of the front
doors, and hold a large antique vase each, which are many centuries old.
Long glass windows, framed by thick velvet curtains, allow plenty of 
sunlight to filter in. The occasional guard can be seen patrolling the 
grounds. A butler, impeccably dressed, greets you in the foyer.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) This golden rope is perfect for tying back curtains or holding up your pants.
     (Magic) A polished wooden pedestal holds an antique vase.
     (Magic) A deep red carpet runs the length of the main hall.
Made from a deep red velvet, these drapes frame the windows.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) An impeccably dressed butler greets you as you enter the foyer.

the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits

being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (1711)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

<1> - You clutch at your chest and keel over.

Stone Avenue
  The sounds of people talking, gravel crunching underfoot and wheels
squeaking surround you as you walk down the Stone Avenue.  All sorts of
people hurry past you as they go about their business.  The buildings that
line the street are tall and for the most part uninviting.  The avenue forks
at this point, you see that it leads to a side street to the east and the
castle gates to the north. 

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A worker from the City of Stone hurries through the city.
(Golden Aura) An old man is here, prophesying the future of the Citadel.

n
Castle Gates
  You get the perfect opportunity to admire the beauty of the Citadel as
you stand at the gates.  The walls are built of many different stones and
gems, creating a glorious pattern across the surface.  The citadel seems to
glow as the sun shines and glints on the polished surface.  You cannot even
imagine how much time it must have taken to build such an amazing building. 
Before coming to the Stone City you had heard many stories of the Citadel's
beauty, but still you did not expect to find a building as magical and
enchanting as this.

Castle Courtyard
  Warm rays of sunlight stream through the tall trees surrounding the stone
coutyard.  In the centre there is a majestic fountain, intricately carved
out of stone with details of amethyst, garnet and diamond.  Ferns and
flowering shrubs brighten up the courtyard and create homes for buzzing
insects and small birds.  The atmosphere is so peaceful here, you feel as if
you could forget all about your mission and spend the rest of your life in
this tranquil place.

Guard Room [**> PK <**]
  The guard room is small and crowded.  The walls and low ceiling are
covered with a texture of small pebbles of many different colours, stuck
tightly together.  You feel uncomfortable in the hot room and damp air. 
Echoing sounds that seem to come from below catch your attention for a
moment.  Your mind returns to the tall guards standing in the room, and you
decide to leave as soon as possible, it is not safe to be here.

s
Before the Fabled City
  The City of Stone looms ahead of you.  The towering stone monuments of
the city contrast with the luscious green of your immediate surroundings.  It
appears majestic, the simple curves of the stone buildings reflect the
sunset slightly, creating an almost eerie feeling.  From this distance you
can't see any movement or life inside the city.  Wondering if the city will
be as quiet and serene inside its walls as it appears from here, you
continue on your journey.

crc; rt stone
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1710)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Deep Jungle (1670)

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

At the Mouth of a Cave (G)
  The path that you followed has led you to an uninviting cave.  It is dark
and eerie, your judgement tells you that it is not wise to proceed further. 
In the distance you hear the faint sounds of screams and swords slashing. 
Wondering what could be happening ahead you decide to continue into the cave
and explore.

Underground Valley
  The light at the end of the tunnel!!  You feel so relieved after being
cramped up in the caverns.  You must be getting closer to the Citadel.  From
a distance, you can hear the warcries and clashing of swords..  Turning your
head towards the sounds, you come upon a small valley that has been burned
down by fighting.  You step closer to the burning bushes and trees and
hear the sounds grow stronger.  You must be close to the battlefield!  

[ Exits: none ]

A Small Clearing
  Stepping out of the bushes, you find yourself in a less dense part of the
forest.  Beams of light from the sky shine down creating leafy patterns over
the ground.  Animals roam peacefully, searching for food and enjoying the
sun.  You feel relieved to be away from the constant fighting, but the
occaisional sound of a muffled scream ahead makes you wonder if even these
tranquil surroundings are safe.

A Small Clearing
  The noises of the battle in the distance become harder to hear as you
walk around the clearing.  The wind is strong and it makes your hair and
clothes blow about you.  The animals in the clearing eye you warily and
scuffle out of your way.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Perfect Road (G)
  You are on the most beautifully kept and built road you've ever seen. 
Each individual stone appears so clean it may have been scrubbed with a
toothbrush, and is set so flawlessly you can barely tell where one stone
ends and the next begins.  The road travels for what appears to be a fairly
short distance towards the north, heading for the largest dome you've ever
seen.  Could that be the infamous Gladiator's Arena?  

[ Exits: north down ]
     It's hard to tell through all the mold, but this bread looks hard as a rock!

n
Outside the Arena (G)
  The road you are on remains nearly perfect in every way, and cleaner than
any you've seen before; yet now you can see signs of traffic on the cobbled
stones, where decades of long hard use have begun to wear the stones a
little TOO smooth.  In front of you is the single largest building you've
ever seen; easily ten stories tall, and at least eight thousand feet in
diameter, this perfect dome is reputed to have been built so well that a
whisper spoken anywhere inside would carry to any other part of the
building.  The walls are unbelievably smooth, and so clean that the sun
practically reflects off of the dark grey granite.  An enormous archway to
the north, fifty feet at its peak and twice as wide, provides access to the
dome.  

[ Exits: south ]
A gigantic man stands here, guarding the doors into the Gladiator's Arena.
The Entrance Guard gets a greedy gleam in his eyes.
The Entrance Guard exclaims, "Welcome to the Gladiator's Arena, sir! For a
 small fee, you may enter and try your skills against some of the finest
 warriors, and... uhm... others the land has to offer!"

any you've seen before; yet now you can see signs of traffic on the cobbled
stones, where decades of long hard use have begun to wear the stones a
little TOO smooth.  In front of you is the single largest building you've
ever seen; easily ten stories tall, and at least eight thousand feet in
diameter, this perfect dome is reputed to have been built so well that a
whisper spoken anywhere inside would carry to any other part of the
building.  The walls are unbelievably smooth, and so clean that the sun
practically reflects off of the dark grey granite.  An enormous archway to
the north, fifty feet at its peak and twice as wide, provides access to the
dome.  

[ Exits: south ]
A gigantic man stands here, guarding the doors into the Gladiator's Arena.
The Entrance Guard gets a greedy gleam in his eyes.
The Entrance Guard exclaims, "Welcome to the Gladiator's Arena, sir! For a
 small fee, you may enter and try your skills against some of the finest
 warriors, and... uhm... others the land has to offer!"

Inside the Gigantic Archway
  Rising to a curved peak some 50 feet above you, the archway you stand
in now is easily the biggest you've ever seen...  Or heard of...  Or even
imagined!  Yet every inch of it is spotlessly clean, and was immaculately
carved, crafted, and set.  Each stone integrates so seamlessly with the next
that not even a speck of mortar is visible, and the entire archway looks
almost like a natural formation.  Even the intricate carvings, spaced at
even intervals approximately one foot apart, that cover the archway were
done by such a master artisan that you could easily believe they were
natural.  The designs seem to have no apparent pattern or significance. 
They seem to be merely random swirls, loops, and assorted geometric
patterns, shaped in such a way that if you stare at them for long enough,
you can see a myriad of different half-formed images, which never quite come
completely to the foreground.  It's eerily similar to the effect you get
when looking at the clouds for a long time, and can see shapes emerging, but
never quite defining themselves.  A little to the east, the dome opens up
into a vastly cavernous space, so large it's hard to believe it's truly
housed within a man-made building...  

[ Exits: east south ]

1971/1971 HP  1826/2387 MP  1714/1714 mv  571tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 88  G 1221344 | Inside the Gigantic Archway (ES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 

You feel yourself slow down.

The sound of the crowds roaring in the distance clues you in; the Gladiators have begun to fight
again!

Inside the Gigantic Archway
  Rising to a curved peak some 50 feet above you, the archway you stand
in now is easily the biggest you've ever seen...  Or heard of...  Or even
imagined!  Yet every inch of it is spotlessly clean, and was immaculately
carved, crafted, and set.  Each stone integrates so seamlessly with the next
that not even a speck of mortar is visible, and the entire archway looks
almost like a natural formation.  Even the intricate carvings, spaced at
even intervals approximately one foot apart, that cover the archway were
done by such a master artisan that you could easily believe they were
natural.  The designs seem to have no apparent pattern or significance. 
They seem to be merely random swirls, loops, and assorted geometric
patterns, shaped in such a way that if you stare at them for long enough,
you can see a myriad of different half-formed images, which never quite come
completely to the foreground.  It's eerily similar to the effect you get
when looking at the clouds for a long time, and can see shapes emerging, but
never quite defining themselves.  A little to the east, the dome opens up
into a vastly cavernous space, so large it's hard to believe it's truly
housed within a man-made building...  

[ Exits: east south ]

1971/1971 HP  1884/2387 MP  1713/1714 mv  571tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 88  G 1218344 | Inside the Gigantic Archway (ES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 

You see the grey moon rising in the east.

e
Entrance to the Gladiator's Arena
  You are in a room so vast that it's beyond all possible imagining.  The
only way your mind can even begin to assess your surroundings is by
partitioning the room into several sections.  Your nearby surroundings, like
everything else you've seen so far, were designed with loving care and
master craftsmanship; yet here the similarities end.  No longer are dirt and
grime removed with what appeared to have been the religious fervor of a
horde of fanatically devoted priests, and a wide variety of stains are
splattered on the ground and walls, the most common of which is a thick,
sticky substance that appears to be blackening rust...  A sight any true
warrior would know in an instant; blood.  The stones are worn in many
places, so heavily trodden upon over the years that you cannot even make out
a discernible path; it seems as if every inch of every stone has been walked
on so often that what may have once been foot-thick granite is now so thin
as to be brittle.  Everywhere you look you see people.  Every 5 to 10 feet a
little cart is set up, with a man or woman hawking their wares to any who
will listen.  Food vendors appear to be the most common, yet it seems as if
you could buy anything your heart desired here.  Most city markets don't
offer this much variety!  Guards, ushers, tourists, and of course Gladiators
of every race and nation wander about here and there, talking, competing in
various games of skill, or simply horsing around.  While the entire building
is far too large to see, much less process in your mind, you can tell that
one of the two most famous areas of this building, the fighting arena
itself, is off towards the east.  Stairs leading up, and a ladder heading
down through a hole in the ground offer other exits, but to destinations
which you cannot quite see from here.  

[ Exits: east west up ]

1971/1971 HP  1943/2387 MP  1713/1714 mv  571tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 88  G 1218344 | Entrance to the Gladiator's Arena (EWU)

Lv 88  G 1218344 | Entrance to the Gladiator's Arena (EWU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


INFO: Evl sinks to their knees and honourably accepts defeat at the hands of a bitter warlock.

e
Entrance to the Fighting Arena
  Spread out before you in a mind-boggling array are all of the various sub
arenas, rings, and cages of the infamous Fighting Arena.  Here it is
possible to engage in just about any form of combat imaginable; anything
from hand to hand fighting to full sieges with body armor and chariots is
available here, all in pre-made environments.  Contests and tournaments are
held here often, sometimes for very large prizes, but most of the time this
entire arena is open to all warriors, of any race or nationality, to
practice or test their skills against each other for sport.  The entire
arena is ringed with raised stands for spectators, but they are not visible
from here.  A flight of stairs would seem to lead towards them, while the
tunnel leading down from here is a relative mystery to you.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
(Red Aura) A Gladiator is walking around, trying to choose the best fight to join.

e
The Group Fighting Rings [**> PK <**]
  Located in a section of the arena roughly 500 feet squared are a series
of "rings," of varying sizes.  Each ring is just an area defined by either a
low rising wooden wall, generally about 3 feet high, a painted circle on the
ground (usually black), or a much taller brick wall, perhaps 8 feet high. 
Many of the rings have thematic decorations inside them, ranging from
designs as simple as "protect the flag," to settings as complex as "protect
the innocents, ration the food and water, and hold off the siege."  This is
where Gladiator groups of almost any size can fight each other, stage fake
sieges, or even fake wars.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Entrance to the Gladiator's Arena
  You are in a room so vast that it's beyond all possible imagining.  The
only way your mind can even begin to assess your surroundings is by
partitioning the room into several sections.  Your nearby surroundings, like
everything else you've seen so far, were designed with loving care and
master craftsmanship; yet here the similarities end.  No longer are dirt and
grime removed with what appeared to have been the religious fervor of a
horde of fanatically devoted priests, and a wide variety of stains are
splattered on the ground and walls, the most common of which is a thick,
sticky substance that appears to be blackening rust...  A sight any true
warrior would know in an instant; blood.  The stones are worn in many
places, so heavily trodden upon over the years that you cannot even make out
a discernible path; it seems as if every inch of every stone has been walked
on so often that what may have once been foot-thick granite is now so thin
as to be brittle.  Everywhere you look you see people.  Every 5 to 10 feet a
little cart is set up, with a man or woman hawking their wares to any who
will listen.  Food vendors appear to be the most common, yet it seems as if
you could buy anything your heart desired here.  Most city markets don't
offer this much variety!  Guards, ushers, tourists, and of course Gladiators
of every race and nation wander about here and there, talking, competing in
various games of skill, or simply horsing around.  While the entire building
is far too large to see, much less process in your mind, you can tell that
one of the two most famous areas of this building, the fighting arena
itself, is off towards the east.  Stairs leading up, and a ladder heading
down through a hole in the ground offer other exits, but to destinations
which you cannot quite see from here.

1688/1971 HP  1530/2387 MP  1712/1714 mv  571tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 88  G 1224091 | Entrance to the Gladiator's Arena (EWU)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Inside the Gigantic Archway
  Rising to a curved peak some 50 feet above you, the archway you stand
in now is easily the biggest you've ever seen...  Or heard of...  Or even
imagined!  Yet every inch of it is spotlessly clean, and was immaculately
carved, crafted, and set.  Each stone integrates so seamlessly with the next
that not even a speck of mortar is visible, and the entire archway looks
almost like a natural formation.  Even the intricate carvings, spaced at
even intervals approximately one foot apart, that cover the archway were
done by such a master artisan that you could easily believe they were
natural.  The designs seem to have no apparent pattern or significance. 
They seem to be merely random swirls, loops, and assorted geometric
patterns, shaped in such a way that if you stare at them for long enough,
you can see a myriad of different half-formed images, which never quite come
completely to the foreground.  It's eerily similar to the effect you get
when looking at the clouds for a long time, and can see shapes emerging, but
never quite defining themselves.  A little to the east, the dome opens up
into a vastly cavernous space, so large it's hard to believe it's truly
housed within a man-made building...  

[ Exits: east south ]

1688/1971 HP  1530/2387 MP  1712/1714 mv  571tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 88  G 1224091 | Inside the Gigantic Archway (ES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Perfect Road (G)
  You are on the most beautifully kept and built road you've ever seen. 
Each individual stone appears so clean it may have been scrubbed with a
toothbrush, and is set so flawlessly you can barely tell where one stone
ends and the next begins.  The road travels for what appears to be a fairly
short distance towards the north, heading for the largest dome you've ever
seen.  Could that be the infamous Gladiator's Arena?

Center of Oasis Island

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

adventurers.

The Grand Entrance to the Fair
  You stand before the gates of a large fair.  A nearby sign proclaims this
to be the Great Tournament of Illoria.  Nearby, you hear melodic tunes
playing, and the mixed aromas of cooked meat and fresh pies fill the air. 
You are glad you came on the day you did - it seems this fair is not to be
missed!

Before a Small Castle
  As the path ends you stand before a small stone castle.  Looking up, you
see one single tower spiraling into the sky.  The gate to the castle is
closed and nobody stands guard.  The castle looks as though it has been kept
up well though.  Its walls are perfectly intact, and the grass around it has
recently been trimmed.  Yet, the castle looks absolutely deserted.

The Castle's Kitchen
  You stand in a small, humble kitchen.  It doesn't look like very much is
being cooked here at the moment.  The kitchen is absolutely immaculate. 
There are no dishes piled in the sink and no crumbs or other bits of food
lying about.  It looks like the rats around here go hungry!  In the center
of the room there is a small table, at which sits a woman in a white apron.

allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.

dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.

being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger

Lady Comfrey's Chambers
  This set of rooms has even more people running every which way
than the kitchen does. The room is huge, even larger than the
lord's. The floor is covered in extremely thick plush carpets
and there are broken art pieces everywhere. The walls are
covered in paintings of the lady herself. A large bed stands
alongside one wall of the room while another wall is completely
covered in mirrors. Above everything you hear a constant screeching
and screaming.

crecall; quest request
cast 'word of recall'
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Into the forest (1704)

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Huldra Forest (1665)

A dark forest
  Wandering through the forest was a bad idea. Not only is it cold and wet, but
also unnaturally dark. Regardless of the time of day, the forest stays the 
same brightness. Even the sounds of the forest have been muffled by some 
unseen force. The remains of an animal trail loop and twist around, 
eventually extending out of sight.

[ Exits: north east south west up ]

watching you.
(Red Aura) A kobold shaman hides in the underbrush, waiting for an ally.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Moat Bridge (1719)

The Sentry Post
  The sentry post is a small structure built into the bridge of the moat to the
castle. It is covered by a thatch roof, and has for furnishings a simple 
table and two chairs. There is a window on the west facing side, through 
which the sentry can watch, if so inclined.

[ Exits: south ]
(Red Aura) A sentry is here, guarding the entrance to the castle.
(Red Aura) A sentry is here, guarding the entrance to the castle.

s
The Moat Bridge
  You are at the farthest end of the bridge over the moat. On each side, there 
is a sentry post. However, despite this evidence of defensiveness, the gates 
to the castle are open. These must be times of peace indeed.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A farmer is resting after a hard day in the fields.
A beggar sits here begging, of all things.
A merchant is here peddling his wares.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Before the Moat
  You stand on one side of a bridge that crosses the moat of the castle. At the
farther end of the bridge, you spot a pair of sentry posts. Beyond this, the 
castle proudly stands. Upon the turrets fly colorful flags which are 
emblazoned with a mighty stallion rampant.

[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) (White Aura) This soldier glares at you with disdain.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Before a Castle

running here, likely engineered to fill the castle's moat. Across the stream,
a small herd of horses graze.

[ Exits: east west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Road to a Castle

1243/2004 HP  1624/2416 MP  1729/1733 mv  671tnl (Reply: Yerald)

>>    *[NOEXP]* At a Crossroad
  Here the road leading north and south crosses with one leading east and west.
In each but the southerly direction, the road ends with castle gates. The 
rolling hills are low enough that you can make out each castle clearly. It is
hard to tell how distant each is, but given the quality of the road, it might
be less than a few hours walk to each.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Road through the Countryside
  You are coming to an intersection of sorts, though you can see that
the road will continue north.  To your west lies a general store, and
to your east, someone has set up an Apothecary shop.

s
Road through the Countryside
  The road runs straight through the countryside, which, on either side, is 
pastoral and peaceful. Some fields have been left fallow, but most have been 
planted with grain crops such as wheat, barley and corn.

[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]

1243/2004 HP  1624/2416 MP  1728/1733 mv  671tnl (Reply: Yerald)

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Road through the Countryside
  You look around you as you follow the road, and see farmers plowing the 
fields, their children playing in the roadside ditches, and the farmers' 
wives churning butter on their front stoops. The whole scene is that of peace
and prosperity.

A beggar sits here begging, of all things.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
A Road through the Countryside
  The road broadens somewhat, and the traffic thickens with farmers, soldiers, 
wagons and riders upon horseback. Most folk nod politely as they pass by, but
some eye you with suspicion. You overhear some passersby discussing unrest 
among the local rulers, known here as the tzars.

[ Exits: north south ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Turn in the Road
  The road through the countryside takes a turn northwards. Once again, ahead 
are rolling fields of wheat, but also some of barley and corn. The land here 
must be quite fertile, for so much farming. It is a peaceful pastoral scene 
before you, indeed.

  This is an exceptionally wide road and from the look of it, well
travelled.  But at last, in the distance you can see a city.  Drawing on
what remaining energy you have left from that walk, you pick up your pace,
almost running.

1243/2004 HP  1624/2416 MP  1728/1733 mv  671tnl (Reply: Yerald)

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
A Road through the Countryside
  Cottages line the road to the north and south. They are small but very tidy 
and in excellent repair, judging by the fresh thatch on the roofs. Each 
cottage has a brightly painted door, representing the only real difference 
among them. Perhaps the farmers, after a long day of toil in the fields and a
few pints of ale afterwards, use the door color as their guide to finding 
home.

[ Exits: east west ]
A child is here, humming a tune.

1243/2004 HP  1624/2416 MP  1728/1733 mv  671tnl (Reply: Yerald)

1243/2004 HP  1624/2416 MP  1722/1733 mv  671tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 89  G 1346628 | Before a Castle on a Hill (WU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

captain catch you here! He can be very nasty after a full bottle of whiskey.

Inside the trader, Typhoon
  You find yourself in a ship, full of opportunities. But don't let the Typhoon
captain catch you here! He can be very nasty after a full bottle of whiskey.
But that's only if he is awakened from his drunken stupor. So this is one of 
the famous trade ships of Lem-Dagor. It's not very impressive right now, as 
it doesn't seem to have a very valuable cargo at the moment.

Guest Room of the Wave Runner
  You have entered the room, where the Wave runners always ask their guests to
stay.  It is very well decorated here, to show respect to the visitors of
the Wave Runner (NOT).  The room is two by two meters and completely
empty, except for a very hard bed.  To the north is the door, but it is
closed, locked and completely impassable.  There has to be some way to get
out of here!  You see some carvings on the wall.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (Linkdead) (OPK) Cyndr The [ERASER] of Existences.
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1729)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1728)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

it doesn't seem to have a very valuable cargo at the moment.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             Boot Camp - Clan MOTD                             
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to Boot Camp!
Be sure to register on our website http://www.aardwolfboot.com
Also join us on Discord: https://discord.gg/GCjHxxZ
and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P
Don't forget our clan skills:
mutare (double / half the weight of an item) 
napalm (str and int buff) 
Always read your notes on the Personal Board, as well as Announce and Mudinfo.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ End of Clan MOTD - Press Return to continue ]

l;ex

Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Guest Room of the Wave Runner
  You have entered the room, where the Wave runners always ask their guests to
stay.  It is very well decorated here, to show respect to the visitors of
the Wave Runner (NOT).  The room is two by two meters and completely
empty, except for a very hard bed.  To the north is the door, but it is
closed, locked and completely impassable.  There has to be some way to get
out of here!  You see some carvings on the wall.  

[ Exits: (north) ]
     A bottle of ghost fish oil is catching your attention.
There are 195 players on, the most on this reboot was 262.
There are 195 players using compression.

PERSONAL: You have 5 unread personal notes.

LOTTERY : Current lottery jackpot is at 120,000,000 gold.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1729)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

The Storm Cruiser, Tempest
  Yes indeed, you are now experiencing one of the many great adventures of the 
Storm Ships of Lem-Dagor. Of course this is the famous cruiser, Tempest, 
where your voyage begins. Look around, look at everything for a clue. There 
is a big sign for you to read.

You step into the gangway and arrive in...
Inside the trader, Typhoon
  You find yourself in a ship, full of opportunities. But don't let the Typhoon
captain catch you here! He can be very nasty after a full bottle of whiskey.
But that's only if he is awakened from his drunken stupor. So this is one of 
the famous trade ships of Lem-Dagor. It's not very impressive right now, as 
it doesn't seem to have a very valuable cargo at the moment.

[ Exits: north ]
Polaf den Tedra has dressed himself snappy today.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Cargo Bay

several cages with creatures inside. Around the table in the middle of the 
room, four traders are playing a strange card game. "I tap your Abyssal 
Spectre with my Icy Manipulator" one trader says.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

2004/2004 HP  1751/2416 MP  1731/1733 mv  671tnl  
Lv 89  G 1355790 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.

GreyAsh Alley
  The small alley continues.  The road is made of gray ash that, while made
of powder, does not stick to your boots or kick into dust as you step.  To
the south, GreyAsh Alley merges with Faeriefog Lane.  Large houses dot the
roads with unusual designs, original decor, and perfectly manicured lawns.

GreyAsh Alley
  You enter a small alley between Grandmarket Boulevard and Darksoil Path. 
To the south, a number of enormous houses of unusual design line the roads. 
Loud clatter marks the masses that fill the shops to the north, while the
cries of shopkeepers trying to draw attention to their wares can be heard

Intersection - GreyAsh Alley + Darksoil Path (G) (1733)

GreyAsh Alley
  This is GreyAsh Alley, between Darksoil and Faeriefog Roads.  To the west,
an enormous house blocks the view outside of the city limits.  The house is
covered in large tiles the size of shields.  On closer inspection, their
earthy tones come to light and present a sort of steel/leather material. 
You run your finger across a silver and black metallic tile that seems to
coalesce and keep your eyes from completely focusing on it.  As you back up
a step and take in the full image of what is before you, a chill runs down
your spine as you realize finally what it is that sides this extravagant
house. Dragon scales.  Hundreds of richly colored dragon scales.

[ Exits: north south (west) ]

GreyAsh Alley (1733)

Faeriefog Lane meets GreyAsh Alley (1733)

Faeriefog + GreyAsh (1733)

GreyAsh Alley
  GreyAsh Alley is given its name for its distinctly grey and powdery
ground-covering.  You notice that, even though it's everywhere on the
ground, nothing has stuck to your boots or your legs.  There are no dust
clouds, and none is caked on the bottoms of your feet.  On closer inspection,
you find that, while it is a light, powdery substance, it is attached firmly
to the road.  GreyAsh Alley continues to the south and meets up with
Faeriefog Lane to the north.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) War Veteran Krynn walks with his hand firmly gripping his blade.

Whitewind Avenue
  The avenue beneath your feet is a pure, pristine white-- unnaturally
white even.  A pleasant wind blows around you, bringing with it the soft
smell of earth and flora.  The smell is light and clean and
revitalizing.  The avenue continues north and south.  To the north the
great city of Aylor expands into its sheer magnificence.  To the south
the gates tower overhead as adventurers old and young make their way
into and out of the city.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1729)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On the way to the Tournament (1733)

The Tournament Arena
  You are standing in the huge tournament arena.  A large crowd is sitting
here, watching the knights battle each other in the combat ring below.  You
smile as the crowd cheers every weapon swing, every dodge, and every parry
of the battling knights.  Working your way toward the front, you find
yourself very close to the action indeed.  You could just hop right into the
combat ring if you so wished!  To the north and south, you see more stands
in the arena.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

>>    *[NOEXP]* Maids' Room
  The lady commands her servants at all hours of the day and night, so they
have a small room attached to hers.  There are eight small cots lined up
along the walls with a few possessions near by.  Above four of the beds
there are bells.  Other than the beds this room is pretty sparse.  There are
some threadbare hangings covering the walls, and a small stove in a corner
to keep out the chill during winter.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Lady Comfrey's Chambers
  This set of rooms has even more people running every which way
than the kitchen does. The room is huge, even larger than the
lord's. The floor is covered in extremely thick plush carpets
and there are broken art pieces everywhere. The walls are
covered in paintings of the lady herself. A large bed stands
alongside one wall of the room while another wall is completely
covered in mirrors. Above everything you hear a constant screeching
and screaming.

[ Exits: east south ]

A Spacious Entrance
  This is a spacious entrance to the lady's rooms.  The sound of screaming
is getting louder and there are people rushing in and out of the door to the
north.  To the south there is a long balcony.  The floor is polished wood
and the walls are covered in draped cloth.  You think you see a pair of
small feet peeking out from under the cloth by the wall.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Intersecting Hallways
  Here is where two hallways intersect with the landing.  The floor beneath
your feet is sunwarmed wood and there are not really many walls.  The east
and west lead to wide hallways.  To the south there is a grand window that
overlooks the courtyard.  To the north there is a staircase that will lead
you back to the lower floor.

>>    *[NOEXP]* East Wing
  This is the wing where the lord's room is located.  The screaming noise is 
reduced to a bare whisper once you are this far away.  The walls here are bare 
and the only decor are a few sets of armor and a sword or two on the wall.  The
ground beneath your feet is also stone.  To the north there is a grand door and
to the south is a door leading to the balcony.
